intro: Ixchelia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Ixchelia mexicana is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in arid environments.
